report.title: Digital Reality (AR/VR/MR) Workshop

description.text: <p>IEEE Computer Society, Hyderabad Section is conceptualizing AR/VR Summit (a.k.a Digital Reality Summit) for Professionals. This program will be executed under IEEE Umbrella @Hyderabad. It will be a Half-Day workshop will be conducted on 11th May'19 where Industry Experts (CEOs, Founders) will share their experiences and future roadmap of Digital Reality</p>

topic.title: Developing AR Apps For Retail Business

report.title: Modelling in UML: A practical introduction

description.text: <p>&nbsp;This session will introduce the Unified Modelling Language (UML) notations and process of building system models, using a practical, hands-on application scenario of building a Conversational System using DialogFlow. The focus will be on modelling a system using UML, with a basic introduction to concepts behind the Conversational System.</p>

topic.title: Modelling in UML: A practical introduction

report.title: Myths and Facts on How to Learn Technology (AI & ML)

description.text: <p>What to learn - when to learn - how to learn is always a challenge and especially with new digital era courses. For example, what to learn in data science which can give job and secure for next 15 years is a big? for fresher to experience, this is not the right way to think about a new technology</p>

topic.title: Myths and Facts on How to Learn Technology

report.title: Robotics and Digital Reality (AR/VR) Workshop

description.text: <p>IEEE Computer Society, Hyderabad Section Supported by Vizag Subsection in association with PSCMRCET is conceptualizing one day workshop on Robotics and Digital Reality (AR/VR) @ Potti Sriramulu College of Engineering , Vijayawada on 20th July 2019. Industry Experts (CEOs, Founders) will share their experiences and future roadmap of Robotics and Digital Reality</p>

topic.title: Humans and Robos together for future world

IEEE Standards Association work on AI & ML

report.title: Edge Intelligence in the IoT

description.text: <p>The proliferation of AI in all aspects of life and work is very visible. Traditional ways of analyzing data and arriving at decisions are being replaced by machine learning (ML). ML has two phases - one, a training phase where a lot of data is used to converge on algorithms to analyze them, and then an inference phase where new data is quickly processed through the algorithm, or 'network', created. In IoT systems, the accent<br />so far has been on sensing and sending data to cloud servers for processing. The IoT nodes, therefore, were created to efficiently collect and transmit data - the nodes did not have the capability to run either phase of ML algorithms internally. There is a case for carrying out analysis and&nbsp;a first level of decision making at the IoT node or device itself. This 'edge intelligence' concept is spreading fast into all kinds of systems - for<br />example, face recognition, medical diagnostics, industrial control systems, etc.<br />This talk provides a background to IoT with Edge Intelligence. It then describes how algorithms can be pushed towards the edge, and how hardware structures can be created to carry out energy efficient computation of ML algorithms or deep neural networks. The talk would cover both hardware and software implementations, and would include performance and power optimization considerations.&nbsp;</p>

report.title: Experimental Quantum Computing and Quantum Cryptography

description.text: <p>IEEE Hyderabad Quantum Computing Special Interest Group (SIG) is an initiative under the Computer Society Chapter<br />of IEEE Hyderabad Section. The SIG, supported by IIIT Hyderabad &amp; Microsoft, brings to you an exclusive sessions on<br />&ldquo;Introduction to Quantum computing&ldquo;. This session will focus on the Basics of Quantum Entanglement, Experimental<br />Quantum Computing and Quantum Cryptography by manipulating light quanta.</p>

description.text: <p>IEEE AHCSSC'20 is third event from IEEE computer Society student congress event with theme as AI, Digital Reality and Robotics. Students and Faculty from 20+ colleges are attending this two day event. Its a flagship event of CS congress</p>

Technical Workshop - MS Renown
Introduction to R in Statastical Analysis

description.text: <p>This Tech talk session will gives an introduce R as a programming<br />language and how it can be used in performing statistical analysis.<br />This will mostly technical oriented. You will be able to know: What<br />is R?, Basic programming concepts in R. How to use R in statistical<br />analysis How analysis can be performed using Supervised and<br />Unsupervised statistical.This session will be mostly technical. Basic<br />understanding of statistics and probability is needed. This session<br />will introduce statistical concepts at a high level but will not go into<br />detail.</p>

topic.title: Introduction to R in statistical Analysis
